tit.e: Kuni-umi (the birth of (the land) of Japan)
Kuni-umi (a myth about the birth of the land of Japan)
Kuni-umi (a myth about the birth of the land of Japan)

sen.j: 国産み（くにうみ）とは、日本の国土創世譚を伝える神話である。
sen.e: Kuni-umi is a myth that tells us how the land of Japan was generated.
Kuni-umi is a myth that tells us how the land of Japan was generated.
Kuni-umi is a myth that tells us how the land of Japan was generated.

sen.j: イザナギとイザナミが天の橋にたち矛で混沌をかき混ぜ島をつくる。
sen.e: Izanagi and Izanami stood on the heavenly bridge, and created islands mixing chaos with a pike.
Izanagi and Izanami stood on the heavenly bridge, and created islands mixing chaos with a pike.
Izanagi and Izanami stood on the heavenly bridge, and created islands mixing chaos with a pike.

sen.j: また、『古事記』などではそののち2神で島を産んだというものである。
sen.e: Also, "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) states that later these two gods gave birth to islands.
Also, "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) states that later these two gods gave birth to the islands.
Also, "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) states that later these two gods gave birth to the islands.

sen.j: この島産みは中国南部、沖縄諸島から東南アジアに広く分布する「大洪水」に似た点が多いといわれる。
sen.e: It is said that this shima-umi (the birth of the islands) myth has many similarities to 'a great flood' which widely ranges from the southern part of China and the Okinawa Islands to Southeast Asia.
It is said that this Shima-umi (the birth of the islands) myth has many similarities to 'a great flood' which widely ranges from the southern part of China, the Okinawa Islands to Southeast Asia.
It is said that this Shima-umi (the birth of the islands) myth has many similarities to 'a great flood' which widely ranges from the southern part of China, the Okinawa Islands to Southeast Asia.

sen.j: なお、国生みの話の後には神生み（かみうみ）が続く。
sen.e: Furthermore, the tale of Kuni-umi is followed by the tale of Kami-umi (the birth of gods).
Furthermore, the tale of the Kuni-umi is followed by the tale of Kami-umi (the birth of gods).
Furthermore, the tale of the Kuni-umi is followed by the tale of Kami-umi (the birth of gods).

sen.j: 以下、この記事では、日本神話において、大八島（おおやしま）がどのように形成されたかを記す。
sen.e: This article will mention how Oyashima (the great islands) were formed.
This article will mention how Oyashima (the great islands; referring to Japan) were formed in Japanese myth.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「日本神話において」を補足しました。
sen.e: This article will mention how Oyashima (the great islands; referring to Japan) were formed in Japanese myth.

sen.j: あらすじ
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 古事記
sen.e: Kojiki
Kojiki
Kojiki

sen.j: 古事記によれば、大八島は次のようにして生まれた。
sen.e: According to Kojiki, Oyashima was born in the following way.
According to Kojiki, Oyashima was born as follows.
According to Kojiki, Oyashima was born as follows.

sen.j: 伊邪那岐（イザナギ）・伊邪那美（イザナミ）という二柱の神は、別天津神（ことあまつがみ）たちに漂っていた大地を完成させることを命じられる。
sen.e: The two gods of Izanagi and Izanami were ordered to complete the floating land by Kotoamatsugami (Literally, Separate heavenly kami) and others.
The two gods of Izanagi and Izanami were ordered to complete the drifting land by Kotoamatsugami (literally, Separate heavenly god) and others.
The two gods of Izanagi and Izanami were ordered to complete the drifting land by Kotoamatsugami (literally, Separate heavenly god) and others.

sen.j: 別天津神たちは、天沼矛（あめのぬぼこ）を二神に与えた。
sen.e: Kotoamatsugami gave the two gods Amenonuboko (literally, heavenly pike).
Kotoamatsugami and others gave the two gods Ame no nuboko (the heavenly jeweled spear).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: Kotoamatsugami and others gave the two gods Ame no nuboko (the heavenly jeweled spear).

sen.j: 伊邪那岐・伊邪那美は、天浮橋（あめのうきはし）に立って、天沼矛で、渾沌とした大地をかき混ぜる。
sen.e: Izanami and Izanagi stood on the Ame no Ukihashi (heavenly bridge), and mixed the chaotic land with Amenonuboko.
Izanagi and Izanami stood on the Ame no Ukihashi (the Heavenly floating bridge) and mixed the chaotic land with Ame no nuboko.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: Izanagi and Izanami stood on the Ame no Ukihashi (the Heavenly floating bridge) and mixed the chaotic land with Ame no nuboko.

sen.j: この時、矛から滴り落ちたものが、積もって島となった。
sen.e: Then something dripping from the pike piled up to be an island.
Then something dripping from the pike piled up to be an island.
Then something dripping from the pike piled up to be an island.

sen.j: この島を淤能碁呂島（おのごろじま）という。
sen.e: This island is called Onogorojima.
This island is called Onogoro-jima Island.
This island is called Onogoro-jima Island.

sen.j: 二神は淤能碁呂島に降り立って会話をし、結婚する。
sen.e: The two gods stepped down onto Onogorojima island, had a conversation, and got married.
The two gods stepped down onto Onogoro-jima Island, had a conversation, and got married.
The two gods stepped down onto Onogoro-jima Island, had a conversation, and got married.

sen.j: 古事記からの引用。
sen.e: Quotations from Kojiki
sen.cmt: 原文は「古事記から引用すると、」でしたが、その後の訳文とのつながりで、「古事記からの引用。」としました。
sen.e: Quotations from Kojiki.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。
sen.e: Quotations from Kojiki.

sen.j: 伊邪那岐
sen.e: Izanagi
Izanagi
Izanagi

sen.j: 「汝身者如何成也」
sen.e: How was your body formed?'
How is your body formed?'
How is your body formed?'

sen.j: 「汝（いまし）が身（み）はいかに成れる」
sen.e: How was your body formed?'
How is your body formed?'
How is your body formed?'

sen.j: 「あなたの体はどのようにできていますか」
sen.e: How was your body formed?'
How is your body formed?'
How is your body formed?'

sen.j: 伊邪那美
sen.e: Izanami
Izanami
Izanami

sen.j: 「妾身層層鑄成 然未成處有一處在」
sen.e: My body grew, but there is a part that did not grow (meaning the female genitalia).'
My body grew, but there is a part that did not grow (meaning the female genitalia).'
My body grew, but there is a part that did not grow (meaning the female genitalia).'

sen.j: 「わが身はなりなりて成り合はざる処一処あり」
sen.e: My body grew, but there is a part that did not grow (meaning the female genitalia).'
My body grew, but there is a part that did not grow (meaning the female genitalia).'
My body grew, but there is a part that did not grow (meaning the female genitalia).'

sen.j: 「私の体には、成長して、成長していないところ（女性器のことを示す）が1ヶ所あります」
sen.e: My body grew, but there is a part that did not grow (meaning the female genitalia).'
My body grew, but there is a part that did not grow (meaning the female genitalia).'
My body grew, but there is a part that did not grow (meaning the female genitalia).'

sen.j: 伊邪那岐
sen.e: Iznagi
Izanagi
Izanagi

sen.j: 「吾身亦層層鑄也 尚有凸餘處一」
sen.e: My body grew and it had a part that grew too much (meaning a penis), so I would like to make land inserting my part that grew too much into your part that did not grow enough. What do you think of giving a birth?'
My body grew and it had a part that grew too much (meaning a penis).'
sen.cmt: 後述の原文に従い、原文・訳文を句点で分割し、かっこを補足しました。
sen.e: My body grew and it had a part that grew too much (meaning a penis).'

sen.j: 「故以此吾身之餘處 刺塞汝身之未成處 為完美態而生國土」
sen.e: So I would like to make land inserting my part that grew too much into your part that did not grow enough.'
sen.cmt: 後述の原文に従い、原文・訳文を句点で分割し、かっこを補足しました。
sen.e: So I would like to make land inserting my part that grew too much into your part that did not grow enough.'

sen.j: 「奈何」
sen.e: What do you think of making land?'
sen.cmt: 後述の原文に従い、原文・訳文を句点で分割し、かっこを補足しました。
sen.e: What do you think of making land?'

sen.j: 「わが身はなりなりて成り余れる処一処あり。」
sen.e: My body grew and it had a part that grew too much (meaning a penis), so I would like to make land inserting my part that grew too much into your part that did not grow enough. What do you think of giving a birth?'
sen.cmt: ４つに分かれていたのを統合。
sen.e: My body grew and it had a part that grew too much (meaning a penis).'
sen.cmt: 原文・訳文を句点で分割し、かっこを補足しました。
sen.e: My body grew and it had a part that grew too much (meaning a penis).'

sen.j: 「故（かれ）このわが身の成り余れる処を以て、汝が身の成り合はざる処を刺し塞ぎて、国土（くに）を生み成さんと以為（おも）ふ。」
sen.cmt: ４つに分かれていたのを統合。
sen.e: So I would like to make land inserting my part that grew too much into your part that did not grow enough.'
sen.cmt: 原文・訳文を句点で分割し、かっこを補足しました。
sen.e: So I would like to make land inserting my part that grew too much into your part that did not grow enough.'

sen.j: 「生むこといかん。」
sen.cmt: ４つに分かれていたのを統合。
sen.e: What do you think of making land?'
sen.cmt: 原文・訳文を句点で分割し、かっこを補足しました。
sen.e: What do you think of making land?'

sen.j: 「私の体には、成長して、成長し過ぎたところ（陰茎のことを示す）が1ヶ所あります。」
sen.e: My body grew and it had a part that grew too much (meaning a penis), so I would like to make land inserting my part that grew too much into your part that did not grow enough. What do you think of giving a birth?'
sen.cmt: ４つに分かれていたのを統合。
sen.e: My body grew and it had a part that grew too much (meaning a penis).'
sen.cmt: 原文・訳文を句点で分割し、かっこを補足しました。
sen.e: My body grew and it had a part that grew too much (meaning a penis).'

sen.j: 「そこで、この私の成長し過ぎたところで、あなたの成長していないところを刺して塞いで、国土を生みたいと思います。」
sen.cmt: ４つに分かれていたのを統合。
sen.e: So I would like to make land inserting my part that grew too much into your part that did not grow enough.'
sen.cmt: 原文・訳文を句点で分割し、かっこを補足しました。
sen.e: So I would like to make land inserting my part that grew too much into your part that did not grow enough.'

sen.j: 「生むのはどうですか。」
sen.cmt: ４つに分かれていたのを統合。
sen.e: What do you think of making land?'
sen.cmt: 原文・訳文を句点で分割し、かっこを補足しました。
sen.e: What do you think of making land?'

sen.j: こうして、二神は性行為を始める。
sen.e: Then two gods began performing a sexual act.
Then two gods began performing a sexual act.
Then two gods began performing a sexual act.

sen.j: しかし、この性交の前に、女性である伊邪那美のほうが、先に男性の伊邪那岐を誘ったために、ちゃんとした子供が生まれなかった。
sen.e: However, it was Izanami, a female god, who seduced Izanagi, a male god, before sexual intercourse, so a normal child was not born.
However, it was Izanami, a female god, who seduced Izanagi, a male god, before sexual intercourse, so a normal child was not born.
However, it was Izanami, a female god, who seduced Izanagi, a male god, before sexual intercourse, so a normal child was not born.

sen.j: 最初に産まれた子供は、水蛭子（ひるこ）であり、二神はこの子を葦舟に乗せて流してしまった。
sen.e: The first born child was Hiruko (The Japanese god of the morning sun), so the two gods got the child on a boat made of reed and washed it down.
The first born child was called Hiruko (literally, Leech Child; God of the Morning Sun) and the two gods swept the baby away on a boat made of reed.
The first born child was called Hiruko (literally, Leech Child; God of the Morning Sun) and the two gods swept the baby away on a boat made of reed.

sen.j: 次に産まれたのは淡島（あはしま）であった。
sen.e: It was Awashima that was born next.
Next, Awashima was born.
sen.cmt: 原文には 「淡島神」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「淡島」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: Next, Awashima was born.

sen.j: 水蛭子と淡島は、伊邪那岐・伊邪那美の子供の内に数えない。
sen.e: Hiruko and Awashima are not counted as children of Izanagi and Izanami.
Hiruko and Awashima are not counted as children of Izanagi and Izanami.
Hiruko and Awashima are not counted as children of Izanagi and Izanami.

sen.j: ちゃんとした子供が生まれないので、二神は、別天津神のもとに赴き、どうするべきかを聞いた。
sen.e: The two gods could not have normal children, so visited Kotoamatsugami, asking what to do.
The two gods who could not have normal children visited Kotoamatsugami to ask him what to do.
The two gods who could not have normal children visited Kotoamatsugami to ask him what to do.

sen.j: すると、占いによって、女から誘うのがよくなかったとされた。
sen.e: Then they had their fortune told, and heard that it was not good for woman to ask a man to have sex.
Then the fortune-telling showed that it was not good for woman to ask a man to have sex.
Then the fortune-telling showed that it was not good for woman to ask a man to have sex.

sen.j: そのため、二神は淤能碁呂島に戻り、今度は男性の伊邪那岐から誘って再び性交をする。
sen.e: Therefore the two gods returned to Onogorojima, and this time the male god, Izanagi, asked her to have sex.
Therefore the two gods returned to Onogoro-jima Island, and this time the male god, Izanagi, asked her to have sex.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。
sen.e: Therefore the two gods returned to Onogoro-jima Island, and this time the male god, Izanagi, asked her to have sex.

sen.j: ここからこの二神は、大八島を構成する島々を生み出していった。
sen.e: Then the two gods generated islands that made up Oyashima.
Then the two gods generated islands that made up Oyashima.
Then the two gods generated islands that made up Oyashima.

sen.j: 産んだ島を順に記すと下のとおりになる。
sen.e: These islands are as follows in the order created.
These islands are as follows in the order created.
These islands are as follows in the order created.

It had one body and four faces.
It had one body and four faces.

sen.j: 顔のそれぞれの名は以下の通り。
sen.e: The names of the faces are as follows.
The names of the faces are as follows.

sen.j: 以上の、八島が最初に生成されたことにより、日本のことを大八島国という。
sen.e: Because the above eight islands were first generated, Japan is called Oyashima no Kuni.
Because the above eight islands were first generated, Japan was called Oyashima no kuni (The Land of Eight Great Islands).
Because the above eight islands were first generated, Japan was called Oyashima no kuni (The Land of Eight Great Islands).

sen.j: 二神は、続けて、6島を産む。
sen.e: The two gods successively made six islands.

The two gods created another six islands continuously.

sen.j: 女島（ひめじま） 姫島村
sen.e: Himejima, Himejima Village
Himejima: Himejima Village
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。
sen.e: Himejima: Himejima Village

sen.j: 別名は、天一根（あめひとつね）
sen.e: Its another name was Amehitotsune.
It was also called Amehitotsune.
It was also called Amehitotsune.

sen.j: 知訶島（ちかのしま） 五島列島
sen.e: Chika no Shima, the Goto Islands
Chika no Shima: The Goto Islands
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。
sen.e: Chika no Shima: The Goto Islands

sen.j: 別名は、天之忍男（あめのおしを）
sen.e: It was also called Ame no Oshio.
It was also called Ame no Oshio.
sen.cmt: 用語表記を変えました。
sen.e: It was also called Ame no Oshio.

sen.j: 両児島（ふたごのしま） 男女群島
sen.e: Futago no Shima, the Danjo Archipelago
Futago no Shima: The Danjo Archipelago

sen.e: Futago no Shima: The Danjo Archipelago

sen.j: 別名は、天両屋（あめふたや）
sen.e: Its another name was Amefutaya.
It was also called Amefutaya.
It was also called Amefutaya.

sen.j: 日本書紀
sen.e: Nihonshoki
Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan)
Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan)

sen.j: 日本書紀の記述は、基本的に伊奘諾（イザナギ）・伊奘冉（イザナミ）が自発的に動いて、国産みを進めていくものである（巻一第四段）。
sen.e: According to Nihonshoki, Izanagi and Izanami basically took action and moved kuni-umi forward voluntarily. (the first volume, section four)
According to Nihonshoki, Izanagi and Izanami basically took action and moved the Kuni-umi forward voluntarily (Section four of the First Volume).
According to Nihonshoki, Izanagi and Izanami basically took action and moved the Kuni-umi forward voluntarily (Section four of the First Volume).

sen.j: また、伊奘諾・伊奘冉のことをそれぞれ陽神・陰神と呼ぶなど、陰陽思想の強い影響がうかがわれる。
sen.e: Izanagi and Izanami were also called gods of yang and yin respectively, which suggests a strong influence of cosmic dual forces ideology.
Izanagi and Izanami were also called gods of yang and yin respectively, which suggests a strong influence of cosmic dual forces ideology.
Izanagi and Izanami were also called gods of yang and yin respectively, which suggests a strong influence of cosmic dual forces ideology.

sen.j: 本書によれば、古事記と同様に、伊奘諾・伊奘冉は、天浮橋（あめのうきはし）に立って、天之瓊矛（天沼矛）で、渾沌とした大地をかき混ぜる。
sen.e: The main text states that Izanagi and Izanami stood on Ame no Ukihashi, and mixed chaotic land with Amenonuboko, and it is the same as Kojiki's tale.
The chronicle states that Izanagi and Izanami stood on the Ame no Ukihashi to mix chaotic land with the Ame no nuboko, just like they did in the Kojiki.
The chronicle states that Izanagi and Izanami stood on the Ame no Ukihashi to mix chaotic land with the Ame no nuboko, just like they did in the Kojiki.

sen.j: この時、矛から滴り落ちたものが、積もって島となった。
sen.e: At this time, something that fell from the pike piled up and an island was made.
At this time, something that fell from the spear piled up and an island was made.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。
sen.e: At this time, something that fell from the spear piled up and an island was made.

sen.j: ただし、この時、他の天つ神は登場しない。
sen.e: However, the other heavenly gods do not appear then.
However, the other heavenly gods do not appear then.
However, the other heavenly gods do not appear then.

sen.j: 『古事記』、『日本書紀』、『先代旧事本紀』、『天書』、『上記』の国産み順の比較したものである。
sen.e: It compared the order of Kuni-umi in "Kojiki," "Nihonshoki," "Sendai Kujihongi" (Ancient Japanese History), and "Uetsufumi" (Ancient Japanese Literature).

It compared the order of the Kuni-umi in "Kojiki," "Nihonshoki," "Sendai Kujihongi" (Ancient Japanese History), "Tensho" (a chronological history of Japan), and "Uetsufumi" (Ancient Japanese Literature).
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「『天書』」を補足しました。
sen.e: It compared the order of the Kuni-umi in "Kojiki," "Nihonshoki," "Sendai Kujihongi" (Ancient Japanese History), "Tensho" (a chronological history of Japan), and "Uetsufumi" (Ancient Japanese Literature).
